intro: Diplolaena eneabbensis, commonly known as the Eneabba diplolaena, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native region. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Diplolaena eneabbensis is often found in coastal heathlands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
